title: Credit Suisse Remakes Board in Aftermath of Scandals
sub_head: Two longtime board members will leave, along with a former colleague of the recently departed chairman, António Horta-Osório
body:
Credit Suisse Group AG said it will reshuffle its board again after a turbulent year.
The Swiss bank, which lost more than $5 billion a year ago from the collapse of family office Archegos Capital Management, is adding former UniCredit SpA Chief Financial oOficer Mirko Bianchi and ex-Wells Fargo & Co. risk officer Amanda Norton, both of whom have extensive banking experience. Keyu Jin, an economics professor at the London School of Economics, will also join.
